subject: Real Estate
title: Empire State Building: The Race to the Sky
description: A quick win: understand Empire State Building: The Race to the Sky.

hook.text: The Empire State Building was built in just 410 days during the Great Depression for $41 million.

buildup.text: Developer John Jakob Raskob was racing Walter Chrysler to build the world's tallest building.

discovery.text: The tower opened 80% empty. It was called the 'Empty State Building' for over a decade.

twist.text: The observation deck's tourist revenue kept the building financially afloat when tenants wouldn't come.

climax.text: Sold in 1951 for $51 million, it's now valued at over $2 billion. Patience paid off spectacularly.

punchline.text: The 'Empty State Building' became a $2 billion icon.

quiz.question: What kept the Empire State Building profitable when it was mostly vacant?
